description.value: This code system defines a set of codes for Insuranceplan Plan Type.

definition.value: Plan with highest monthly premium and lowest costs when you need care. A Qualified Health Plan with the highest monthly premiums and smallest out-of-pocket costs for the member in comparison to other metal-category plans.

Plan with high monthly premium and low costs when you need care. A Qualified Health Plan with the higher monthly premiums and smaller out-of-pocket costs for the member in comparison to other metal-category plans.

Plan with moderate monthly premium and moderate costs when you need care. A Qualified Health Plan with the lower monthly premiums and larger out-of-pocket costs for the member in comparison to other metal-category plans.

Plan with lowest monthly premium and highest costs when you need care. A Qualified Health Plan with the lowest monthly premiums and largest out-of-pocket costs for the member in comparison to other metal-category plans.
A plan with low monthly premiums and very high deductibles and are available only to those under 30 or with certain special exemptions.
A plan that requires the insured to pay out of pocket a smaller proportion of incurred health care costs than a traditional insurance plan.
A plan that requires the insured to pay out of pocket a larger proportion of incurred health care costs than a traditional insurance plan.
A plan that requires the insured to pay out of pocket a much larger proportion of incurred health care costs than a traditional insurance plan.
